item.title: Error message using Azure data lake store destination in SSIS
item.description: To be able to interact with Azure services using SSIS, you need to install SSIS feature pack for Azure But even after installing service pack, if you are using Azure Data Lake store destination with file formats - ORC or Parquet, you’ll get this error message: Error message: [Azure Data Lake Store Destination [2]] Error: System.Exception: Java SE is required to use ORC format. Solution as mentioned in the link above is to install Java SE Runtime environment as its a pre-requisite/dependency.

item.title: P/E Ratio
item.description: Definition Price-to-earnings ratio or P/E of a company measures its current share price relative to its per-share earnings (EPS). Source: Investopedia $$ P/E \,ratio = {Share \,price \over Earnings \,per \,share} $$ Significance Let’s calculate P/E ratio of a fictional company Avi Corp. which is trading currently at $100 per share. Their EPS (Earnings per-share) is $20, making their P/E ratio = 100⁄20 = 5. This can be interpreted as - “investors are willing to pay $5 for every $1 of company’s earnings”

item.title: Suez Canal in the time of COVID-19
item.description: I doubt if any individual or industry on this planet is unaffected by the Coronavirus pandemic (hence a pandemic duh!). In this post I wanted to share some interesting facts I learned by following the news trail about oil prices. Let’s start with what happened to oil prices in April 2020. A little background on Oil trading is necessary to grasp the full picture, so here we go: Oil is traded on its future price.

item.title: Annual Percentage Yield
item.description: Annual percentage yield1 measures the total amount of interest paid on an account based on the interest rate and the frequency of compounding. $$APY=100[(1 + \frac{interest}{principal})^{\frac{365}{days in term}} -1]$$ $$interest = principal[(\frac{APY}{100} + 1)^{\frac{days in term}{365}} -1]$$ So when a bank advertises that a savings account with them will earn 1.50 % APY, that’s the interest rate, frequency of compounding is usually 365 days or 1 year and principal is the amount you will choose to deposit with them.
